title: 110_s1214
content: Invest in Small Business Act of 2007 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) increase the exclusion from gross income of gain from the sale or exchange of qualified small business stock from 50 to 75 of such gain and to reduce the required holding period for such stock from five to four years. (2) allow a 100 exclusion of gain from such stock sold by a business in an empowerment zone. (3) deny a tax exclusion for small business stock held by a 25 controlled corporate group. (4) repeal as an item of tax preference under the alternative minimum tax the exclusion of gain from the sale of small business stock. (5) repeal the 28 income tax rate on the gain from the sale of small business stock which is not excluded from gross income. (6) revise the definition of qualified small business for certain tax purposes to mean a C corporation with aggregate gross assets not exceeding $100 million. And (7) provide for an annual inflation adjustment to the small business aggregate gross asset amount after 2007.
